channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: As Trump refuses to lead, America tries to save itself
Anderson Cooper: Trump poses with can of beans while virus surges
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper called out a recent Instagram endorsement by President Donald Trump amid surges in the coronavirus pandemic across the US and ongoing tension between the White House and Dr. Anthony Fauci, saying it's "grotesque."

item.title: The muddled public message on coronavirus isn't just confusing. It's harmful
item.description: • LIVE UPDATES: Australian state registers its worst day since the pandemic began • Atlanta mayor says Trump broke law by not wearing mask • These states have tamed coronavirus, even after reopening

item.title: A hospital owner allegedly scammed patients out of $350,000 using fake Covid-19 tests
item.description: A hospital owner in Bangladesh was arrested Thursday on charges of fraud, after allegedly issuing thousands of fake Covid-19 test results to deceive patients out of an estimated $350,000, in a wide-ranging scam that has shaken confidence in the country's medical establishment.

item.title: Zindzi Mandela tested positive for Covid-19 on the day she died, son says
item.description: Zindzi Mandela, South Africa's ambassador to Denmark and daughter of anti-apartheid leaders Nelson and Winnie Mandela, tested positive for Covid-19 on the day she died, her son Zondwa Mandela told South Africa's public broadcaster, SABC, Wednesday.

item.title: Footage shows ships damaged by fire at Iranian port city
item.description: A fire has damaged at least seven vessels in a port city in Iran, acording to state media. Just two weeks after a fire at a nuclear complex, it's the latest in a series of mysterious incidents at key locations around the country. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

item.title: Schoolgirl who traveled to Syria to join ISIS should be allowed to return to UK, judges rule
item.description: Shamima Begum, the British teenager who left London with two schoolfriends in 2015 to join ISIS in Syria, should be allowed to return to the UK to challenge the deprivation of her British citizenship, judges ruled Thursday.

item.title: India reports highest daily jump in new cases so far
Why the Trump administration's win over Huawei could be bad news for TikTok
item.description: A week after saying his administration was "looking at" banning short-form video app TikTok in the United States, President Donald Trump claimed credit for personally thwarting the expansion plans of another Chinese-affiliated technology company: Huawei.

item.title: 33-year-old tech CEO found dismembered in New York apartment
item.description: A 33-year-old tech CEO was found dismembered in a luxury New York condo, a law enforcement source told CNN.

item.title: Covid-19 cases among US military causes mistrust in Okinawa
item.description: More US service members in Okinawa, Japan are testing positive for Covid-19, causing growing mistrust in an already troubled relationship between the two countries.

item.title: South Korea's president says he's a feminist. Three of his allies have been accused of sex crimes
item.description: The woman who accused Seoul's mayor of sexual harassment says the city government told her he wasn't "that kind of person" when she made her complaint, according to two non-profit organizations working with her.

item.title: Trump shakes up campaign leadership as he struggles in latest polls
How New Zealand became the apocalypse bunker of the world
item.description: In Queenstown — a picturesque ski spot that often attracts comparisons to Aspen, Colorado — rumors about foreigners investing in apocalypse-proof bunkers have been swirling for years.

item.title: GOP state rep. claims Florida is doing 'just fine.' See CNN anchor read the stunning data to him
item.description: Florida Republican state lawmaker Rep. Anthony Sabatini, who has filed numerous lawsuits to prevent mask mandates in his state, tells CNN's Brianna Keilar that his state is doing just fine despite data showing Florida is a hotspot for coronavirus.

item.title: Republican governor absolutely dismantles the herd immunity crowd's argument
item.description: Tate Reeves is the Republican governor of Mississippi. He's also an economics major who worked for a bank prior to getting into politics.

item.title: Supreme Court rules federal execution of Wesley Purkey can proceed
item.description: The Supreme Court cleared the way for the federal execution of 68-year-old Wesley Purkey Thursday morning after a lower court judge halted his execution and ordered further evaluation of claims about Purkey's mental competency.

item.title: Twitter blames 'coordinated' attack on its systems for massive hack
item.description: Twitter accounts belonging to Bill Gates, Elon Musk, Apple and Uber, among other prominent handles, were compromised on Wednesday and posted tweets that appeared to promote a cryptocurrency scam.

item.title: A man in a coma from coronavirus woke up paralyzed
item.description: For Eddie Case, recovering from Covid-19 comes with hard work and uncertainty.

item.title: Arizona and Texas counties hit hard by coronavirus bring in refrigerated trucks as morgues fill up
item.description: With skyrocketing coronavirus hospitalizations in several states, hard-hit counties in Arizona and Texas are preparing for the worst by bringing in refrigerated trucks as morgues fill up.

item.title: Nick Cannon to remain on Fox show after ViacomCBS fired him over anti-Semitic comments
item.description: Nick Cannon is keeping his job as host of competition series "The Masked Singer" following his apology for recent anti-Semitic remarks.

item.title: Before taking her own life, triathlete asked mother to 'lay bare the sins' of alleged abusers
item.description: He's a typically proud father as he recalls the joy of his daughter winning a medal.

item.title: These states have tamed coronavirus. Here's how they're doing it
item.description: When Covid-19 suddenly ravaged New York, hospitals looked "apocalyptic." Refrigerated trucks turned into morgues because there wasn't enough space for all the victims.

item.title: Trump's niece asked if she has proof that someone took SATs for him
item.description: In an interview with ABC, Mary Trump stood by a claim in her book that her uncle, President Donald Trump, paid someone to take the SATs for him to help get him into the University of Pennsylvania, which the White House has denied.

item.title: Will Trump try to self-pardon?
item.description: President Donald Trump has used his pardon power sparingly, but overwhelmingly to benefit his friends and to protect his own interests. Former George W. Bush Administration official Jack Goldsmith recently analyzed Trump's pardons for Lawfare and concluded that "no president in American history comes close to matching Trump's systematically self-serving use of the pardon power."

item.title: CNN anchor tweets that he's still waiting for test results. His colleague responds
item.description: CNN reporters Fred Pleitgen and Victor Blackwell discuss the stark contrast of coronavirus testing in the US and Germany.

item.title: Here's proof that Trumpism is forever for Republicans
item.description: When conservative thinker and writer Jonathan V. Last declared that "Trump is forever" back in December 2019, he may not have known how right he would prove to be.

item.title: America's secret weapon against a plummeting world population
item.description: The only way the United States can remain the world's most prosperous, powerful country is by embracing immigration. That's the inescapable conclusion from a new study published on Tuesday in the Lancet that predicts the world's population will peak far sooner than anticipated, and start shrinking before the end of this century.

item.title: This may be a test for the Tokyo Olympics
item.description: For the first time this season, up to 5,000 fans are allowed to enter Japan's professional baseball stadiums - but will have to adhere to a long list of virus prevention measures. The game will give viewers a glimpse into what the Olympics could look like with the half-capacity, social distanced stadium.

item.title: Trump's niece calls for President to resign
item.description: If Mary Trump were in the Oval Office with her uncle Donald Trump today, she would tell him to resign, she told ABC's George Stephanopoulos in an interview to support her explosive tell-all book about the President.

item.title: North Carolina city votes to approve reparations for Black residents
item.description: In a historic move, the city of Asheville, North Carolina, voted unanimously to approve a reparations resolution for Black residents Tuesday night.

item.title: He has over 6M TikTok followers. Here's why he is concerned
item.description: TikTok, the popular Chinese app that struck a chord with Gen Z, has found itself navigating tricky political territories. Following India's ban, now the US is also looking to block TikTok citing security concerns. CNN's Hadas Gold reports on the pressure TikTok and its community face.

item.title: Elena Delle Donne 'shocked' her WNBA season medical opt-out request was denied, Mystics say she'll be paid
item.description: Elena Delle Donne, the reigning WNBA MVP, wants to play basketball.

item.title: This flying photographer is documenting how humans are impacting the planet
item.description: Flying hundreds of feet above the ground in a motorized paraglider, George Steinmetz has photographed the world's most remote environments from the sky.

item.title: Errors end Liverpool's record points chase with defeat at Arsenal
item.description: Having won its first English top-tier title for 30 years in such a convincing manner, breaking records was the main thing left on Liverpool's agenda.

item.title: World's largest retailer will require customers to wear masks
item.description: Walmart will require customers at all of its US stores to wear masks beginning next week, becoming the largest retailer to mandate facial coverings as coronavirus cases continue to rise.

item.title: Scientist found more than 100 new species in a remote fjord
item.description: On the Pacific fringes of Chile lies a biological haven. Along the Patagonian coast, surrounded by majestic snow-capped mountains, corals live among some of the deepest fjords in the world. New species are being discovered here; there are still areas waiting to be documented. But even as the reefs' secrets reveal themselves, there is trouble in paradise.

item.title: Teenage boy dies from bubonic plague after eating marmot
item.description: A 15-year-old boy has died from bubonic plague in western Mongolia, according to government health officials.

item.title: Pandemic can't stop Simone Biles' stunning aerial display
item.description: US Olympic gymnast Simone Biles posted video of her performing a string of skills that she says she hadn't attempted since she was 13.

item.title: Man survives bear attack in his kitchen
item.description: A Colorado man knew something was wrong when he heard a commotion early Friday morning in the Aspen house where he's staying with his kids.

item.title: Eating fish could help protect aging brains from air pollution, study finds
item.description: Eating more than one to two servings a week of fish or shellfish may counteract the effects of air pollution on the brain, a new study finds.

item.title: Alligator charges kayaker. See what happens next
item.description: A kayaker navigating the Waccamaw River in North Carolina had a close call with a nearby alligator.

item.title: As the pandemic worsens, major retailers, grocery stores, and state leaders are making the tough decisions the President has shirked
item.description: • Fauci holds ground against 'bizarre' WH attacks • US continues to set Covid-19 records • LIVE: 'I just want to do my job,' Fauci says • Jake Tapper calls out White House

item.title: Trump demotes campaign chief amid poor opinion poll numbers
item.description: • Analysis: 2020's latest boogeyman is 'Secret Trump voters' • Poll: Biden takes 15-point lead over Trump • Analysis: Here's proof that Trumpism is forever

item.title: Jake Tapper calls out White House: Let me not be diplomatic
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper says that the campaign by White House officials to undermine Dr. Anthony Fauci in the midst of a global pandemic is "disgusting" and the "ultimate in irresponsibility."

item.title: Most Americans don't trust the President, but they do trust Dr. Fauci
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: Vogue boss 'racially profiled' while trying to enter his own office
item.description: British Vogue's editor Edward Enninful said he was racially profiled on the way into work, with a security guard instructing him to enter the magazine's premises via the loading dock.

item.title: Demi Moore explains her carpeted bathroom
item.description: Demi Moore's bathroom has gone viral and she thinks it's hilarious.

item.title: Fire 'spreads to seven ships at Iranian port'
item.description: A fire has damaged least seven vessels at a shipyard in the southern Iranian port city of Bushehr, despite the efforts of firefighters, according to state media.
